poem:
### Harrods in the Morning

the gleaming halls
scent of richest cologne—
a shiver,
whispers haunt the marble floors,
masks polished lies:
he stands,
a shadowed emperor,
no throne but rumor's reign,
golden façades
crack
under silent cries
never heard but felt.
